confession.seduction_context: After great quarrel with wife of Bastien le Sellier, of le Viel Marché; devil appeared and offered to teach her 'les moyens d'en avoir la raison'. Next day returned when she was in her garden, said she had been making many pilgrimages to have children, and since God had not helped her, she agreed to believe in him and renounce God
sabbat_activities: creating mist and caterpillars to eat tree leaves

testimony.quarrel_subject: took end of stick from her garden

testimony.threat_quote: asked why she was doing this, suggesting she might make the child ill
s'il ne guerissoit en bref, il s'en iroit aupres d'ung devin s'il apprenoit qu'elle l'ayt ensorcellé il la feroit prendre et brusler

harms_alleged.time_after_quarrel: 2 months after fetching fish from Trois Maisons

witnesses.name: Jennon fille feu Colas Michiel de Marzelay

timeline.subject: Barbelline femme Holbin le Jalley
timeline.details: Initial witness depositions (date approximate, year 1596 stated)

timeline.subject: Barbelline femme Holbin le Jalley
timeline.details: Change de Nancy approved showing her 'appareils de la question'

timeline.subject: Barbelline femme Holbin le Jalley
timeline.details: Procureur asked she be given question ordinaire with allowance for her age

timeline.subject: Barbelline femme Holbin le Jalley
timeline.details: Change de Nancy recommended she be renvoyée (released)

timeline.subject: Barbelline femme Holbin le Jalley
timeline.details: Case reopened with depositions from 4 more witnesses

timeline.subject: Barbelline femme Holbin le Jalley
timeline.details: Subjected to question ordinaire; confessed under torture

timeline.subject: Barbelline femme Holbin le Jalley
timeline.details: Death sentence from Change de Nancy

accomplices_named.name: Jennon (daughter of Guillaume le Bouchier's wife)
Libaire sister of Guillaume le Bonnetier
Dion femme Colas Babon
accomplices_named.context: seen at sabbat; had accused her

accomplices_named.name: Meline veuve Martin Gentilhomme
accomplices_named.context: confronted with accused, claimed to have seen her at sabbat

accomplices_named.name: la Malreannaix
accomplices_named.context: declared she had seen her at sabbat

accomplices_named.name: Bastien des Aulx
accomplices_named.context: man with black face seen at sabbat, might have been him

notable_quotes.speaker: Pierre Parisot (former doyen in court)
notable_quotes.french: mesme de la forme qu'on luy pourroit donner la question... enduroit beaucoup de tourmens, mais sy elle les pouvoit endurer que ce seroit bien faict et quele eschapperoit
notable_quotes.english: especially about the form in which they might give her the question... would endure much torment, but if she could endure it that would be good and she would escape
notable_quotes.context: advice given to accused while fleeing, about how to respond to torture

notable_quotes.speaker: Nicolas fils Holbin le Jalley
notable_quotes.french: s'il ne guerissoit en bref, il s'en iroit aupres d'ung devin s'il apprenoit qu'elle l'ayt ensorcellé il la feroit prendre et brusler
notable_quotes.english: if he did not recover soon, he would go to a diviner and if he learned that she had bewitched him he would have her taken and burned
notable_quotes.context: threat to Barbelline regarding his father's illness from bitter soup

notable_quotes.speaker: Barbelline
notable_quotes.french: que sy son marit a eu quelque maladie, c'est dieu qui le print, pour ce qu'il a retenu deux francs pour le loyer d'une sienne chambriere
notable_quotes.english: if her husband had some illness, it is God who took him, because he withheld two francs for the rent of his chambermaid
notable_quotes.context: initial response when asked about husband's illness

notable_quotes.speaker: Devil (in confession)
notable_quotes.french: qu'elle estoit bien en peine de faire des pellerinages pour avoir des enfans. Mais si elle vouloit croire a luy, et renoncer Dieu, il luy enseigneroit bien les moyens pour avoir des enfans
notable_quotes.english: that she was very troubled making pilgrimages to have children. But if she would believe in him and renounce God, he would teach her the means to have children

notable_quotes.speaker: Barbelline (in confession)
notable_quotes.french: vrayment elle avoit fait faire beaucoup de pellerinages pour avoir des enfans, et tant prié dieu, mais puis qu'il ne l'avoit aydé pour en avoir, elle estoit contente de croire à luy, et renoncer dieu
notable_quotes.english: truly she had made many pilgrimages to have children and prayed to God so much, but since he had not helped her to have them, she was content to believe in him and renounce God

notable_quotes.speaker: Barbelline (in confession)
notable_quotes.english: the harm is too deeply rooted
notable_quotes.context: when asked if her husband could be cured of the poisoning

relationships.evidence_text: currently wife of Holbin le Jalley, married 8 or 9 years
Had been married for 49 years to Dion Chastenay
gone off to consult her nephew Jean de Sarrux
consult her brother Adam de Sarrux at Sarrux
Nicolas fils Holbin le Jalley (Nicolas son of Holbin le Jalley)
his cousine germaine Phelisse, wife of Jean Gillet
Phelisse, wife of Jean Gillet of Trois Maisons
in house of brother-in-law Adam Bassat
near neighbour of Barbelline at Trois Maisons

relationships.person1: Jennon fille feu Colas Michiel de Marzelay
Jennon fille feu Colas Michiel de Marzelay
relationships.evidence_text: Jennon fille feu Colas Michiel de Marzelay (daughter of deceased Colas Michiel)
Georgeatte femme Jean Cailleré des Trois Maisons

economic_context.details: Debt dispute mentioned: Valentin Sagant de la Bolle owed her money and failed to repay; property transaction: Phelisse bought goods from accused's husband and accused was very angry. Accused's husband allegedly withheld two francs for chambermaid's rent. Niece had goods worth more than 1,200 francs mentioned as marriage proposal.

harms_catalog.harm_description: became ill, only recovered after she visited him
harms_catalog.precipitating_quarrel: took stick from her garden and she told him off

harms_catalog.harm_description: swollen as if pregnant, as if she had animal inside her, died Thursday
harms_catalog.precipitating_quarrel: bought goods from husband of accused, accused was very angry

harms_catalog.victim_name: child of Marion and Claudon du Haut
harms_catalog.harm_description: previously healthy, sickened, now only skin and bone
harms_catalog.precipitating_quarrel: asked why carrying child around neck, suggesting might make child ill; touched and kissed the child

harms_catalog.harm_description: lost power to feel or speak after drinking bitter soup
harms_catalog.precipitating_quarrel: husband was rude and harsh to her
hatred for his previous deposition against her
harms_catalog.time_between_quarrel_and_harm: 2 months after fetching fish from Trois Maisons

harms_catalog.precipitating_quarrel: great quarrel with wife of Bastien le Sellier
harms_catalog.time_between_quarrel_and_harm: week after seduction, died within a week

harms_catalog.precipitating_quarrel: failed to repay debt he owed her
harms_catalog.method_alleged: sprinkled powder on his clothes when met on road

harms_catalog.harm_description: made ill, then cured by sending bread and salt
harms_catalog.method_alleged: powder, then cured with bread and salt

harms_catalog.precipitating_quarrel: refused to cook easter tart for her

harms_catalog.harm_description: lost her milk so children had to be put out to nurse
plague of small caterpillars which ate all the leaves of the trees
harms_catalog.attributed_to: Barbelline femme Holbin le Jalley and sabbat attendees
harms_catalog.method_alleged: powder in earthenware pot stirred with stick, thrown into air to create mist

harms_catalog.harm_description: given to master to be eaten at sabbat

material_culture.context: taken from her garden by Nicolas Claudon Lamblat
from house of witch to bring healing to Mengeon Guichard
bitter soup that made Holbin le Jalley ill
Nicolas Lambert fetched from Trois Maisons for relatives
magical powder used to kill and harm
sent to cure Claudon le Tisserand
refused to be cooked by Pasquatte
used at sabbat to mix powders for crop destruction
used to stir powder at sabbat; also Barbelline found with stick chasing black dog
given to devil to be eaten at sabbat

residence of several witnesses and victims
where accused's nephew Jean de Sarrux and brother Adam de Sarrux lived
residence of Valentin Sagant and Claudon le Tisserand
where devil appeared to Barbelline; where stick was taken from
where Barbelline met Valentin Sagant and powdered his clothes
where Marion and Claudon du Haut were going when carrying child
mysterious noises at night, Barbelline found with stick chasing black dog

animal_predation: big black dog in kitchen (possibly supernatural)
economic_hardship_indicators: dispute over two francs for chambermaid's rent

prior_legal_disputes.description: Claudon le Tisserand of la Bolle accused her of theft

legal_context.imprisonment_conditions: fled initially to consult relatives, advised by Pierre Parisot (former doyen) on how to survive torture

hearsay_chains.content: illness of Mengeon Guichard and need to get bread, salt, ashes from accused's house
story of purchase and subsequent illness and death of Phelisse

emotional_state_notes: frightened officer was coming to arrest her
so upset she did not remember advice given by Pierre Parisot

third_parties.context: diviner consulted about Mengeon Guichard's bewitchment

third_parties.context: failed to repay debt, killed with powder on road

extraction_metadata.notes: Document is badly damaged with sections rotted away. Witness 5 completely missing. Some details may be incomplete due to document condition. Case reopened after initial release recommendation. Age stated as 'about 75' for both accused and husband. Marriage proposal value of 1,200 francs mentioned. Confession obtained under torture after case was reopened.
